column1: The '''Lonely Troll''' is one of the main characters in [[Samwise Gamgee]]'s playful nonsense poem, ''Perry-the-Winkle''.  This was a very unusual [[Trolls
column2: Troll]]: He wanted friends, he did not steal, drink beer, or even eat meat, and most amazingly of all, he was a very good cook. column1: One day the Lonely Troll decided to seek friendship in [[the Shire]].  When he came to [[Michel Delving]] though the inhabitants ran and hid.  The poor troll sat down outside of the [[Lockholes]] and wept.  It was then that a [[Hobbits
column2: hobbit]] lad, Perry-the-Winkle, came up and befriended him.  The happy troll took Perry home for tea and fed him generously.

column1: When the other hobbits learned that Perry-the-Winkle had been so handsomely fed they all went to the Troll's house to demand food for themselves.
